ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Directed Studies (especially literature) is a trial by fire. You learn to read, you learn to write, and you learn how to do more work than you can.

I gained knowledge about literary history and theory, and meaningful skills in literary analysis and criticism. Thanks to our discussions, I gained insights into incredibly influential texts and into the human condition at large.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Directed Studies, in a word, is great. A few of the books on the syllabus wouldnt be my choice, but thats just a matter of taste. My biggest issue is that the instructors can vary pretty wildly in difficulty, and sometimes it can feel like your professor, rather than your learning, determines your grade.

Strengths: consistent engagement and writing practice
Weaknesses: too much reading for too little time
I think that the course had a really great series of lectures and all the guests were particularly interesting. The main improvement to the course would be the syllabus, which felt crammed at times.

Strengths: Wonderful professor; great introduction to modern literature; very helpful way of developing skills in writing and literary analysis 
Weaknesses: the pace and the volume of reading. It would be great to see fewer texts treated in the DS Lit track, with more time and attention given to each one.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Most people use these reviews to talk about Directed Studies, but that neglects the most important thingthe professor. Take Directed Studies: Literature with Jan Hagens not because its Directed Studies: Literature, but because its with Jan Hagens. Of all the professors Ive had at Yale, he is the kindest, sweetest, and the most fun. Take his section!
Yes; it is a great way to get to know Western canon literature and gain analytical reading skills.

Absolutely! The course is an amazing introduction to modern literature, a great way to develop writing skills, and a fascinating class overall. Prof. Hagens is a wonderful professor who truly cares about his students and makes each seminar engaging and revelatory.
